str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the base of basis; a step, i.e. Foot-breath; by implication, a rostrum, i.e. A tribunal.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
No one, none, nothing.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
From dike; equitable; by implication, innocent, holy.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: I am acted upon in a certain way, either good or bad; I experience ill treatment, suffer.
Much, many; often.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
A dream. Of uncertain derivation; a dream.
Today, now. Neuter of a presumed compound of the article ho and hemera; on the day; generally, now.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
